content.description: This is a fun 5.8+ that makes you work on some sloper holds. Shaded in the mornings with full sun in the afternoon.
content.protection:
4 bolts

*As of 5-8-2020 there are no chains on top of this route, but there are two very rusted pitons.
content.location: This climb is on the west side of the first rock outcropping as you get to the wall from the trail. Just to the east of Confidence Booster on the west facing wall.

content.description: Crux is the roof traverse if you traverse underneath the roof. If you traverse above the roof, it's just a sustained 9+ or 10a.
content.protection: Two bolts at the top for anchor, both now have quicklinks attached due to accommodating climbers. Decent trad placement up top if you want to lower off your own gear, can walk to the top afterwards and pick up your gear.
content.location: Located on the South facing side of the Northern part of the crag. Bolt is around 7-8 ft off the ground.

content.description: Left of the newly bolted 5.6. Start on the same ramp and then traverse under the roofs ending on top to anchors.
content.location: Left of the 5.6 your first good piece is right under the roof.

content.description:
A bit overhanging with sharp holds rough on the fingers. Rating is mostly for the overhang. There is plenty to hold onto if you look.

Working on getting this route bolted.
content.location:
This is the first outcropping of rock you come to from the trail.  The climb is on the east side of the rock, opposite from west side climb.  Well shaded in the afternoon. Belay is on a bit of a slope.

Chain's are a little difficult to reach from the top. It may be good practice to set up some protection to reach them. There is an old piton you could clip into on top but not recommended.

content.description: This is a fist/offwith with plenty of good holds on the out side of the crack as well, if you intermingle crack and face climbing I'd call it a 5.7.
content.protection: Camalots, 2-#3, 1-#4, and a sling 2/3 the way up. Some stoppers if you protect the face instead of the crack. Build your own anchor on top.
content.location: Furthest route to the left of confidence booster.

content.description: This starts with some friction moves on a slope bit of rock before going vertical. Lots of large jugs on the lower portion then thinning out at the top. Great first assent for kids.
content.location: This climb is located between the two more overhanging rock features, set back in the rock between the two. Climb goes up the middle of the darker colored rock.
